JobFullDesc: In Microsoft Teams Core Chats, Channels and Messaging group, we build communication and collaboration experiences for our millions of users. Our domain covers the entire messaging experience in the desktop and web client. We are constantly working to improve the way people collaborate in real time within the Microsoft Teams product.  As a Software Engineer in our team, you are expected to provide critical thinking, a high degree of technical innovation and attention to detail. You will define technical capabilities and be able to design, develop, and test solutions while working closely with our Dev, PM and Design teams.  Highly qualified candidates are passionate about creating and supporting next generation products and services, demonstrate capable development skills, have a passion for quality and performance, and are excited to build solutions with customer-centric experiences.  Responsibilities• Define well thought out architecture, design, and code with an emphasis on quality, simplicity, maintainability, and performance.  • Consider and advocate for customer’s perspective and experiences and help define innovative solutions to address their concerns. • Communicate effectively and partner with other disciplines of the project team to deliver high quality solutions from envisioning to deployment to live site availability. QualificationsSkills (Must Have)  Experience: oTotal of 3+ years of demonstrated work experience in creating performant and delightful user experience-based features. oComputer Science or similar engineering degree.  Architecture/Design Engineering Skills: oExperience with React, AngularJS or another modern web framework. o Experience with large scale data analytics and failure analysis. o Experience improving performance of JavaScript-based applications.  Engineering Practices: oExperience utilizing Requirement, Design, & Code Review practices. oAwareness of performance testing, security testing, privacy testing, accessibility. testing, and localization/globalization testing.  Other skills: oAbility to work in cross functional teams and strong interpersonal skills. oAbility to collaborate with, learn from, and coordinate with others.  oAbility to problem-solve in ambiguous situations.  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
